value.title: Fintech Roundup: How going Fast and furious can ruin your startup
value.excerpt: The big events in the fintech world over the last week felt like a very different vibe from 2021, which was filled with mega rounds, celebrations and lofty valuations. First off, 3-year-old one-click checkout startup Fast announced it was shutting down after struggling to raise more capital to keep operations running.

value.title: New FinTech App Aims to Have Crypto Trading Intelligence in the Palm of Your Hands
value.excerpt: ToroAlerts, LLC, a Portland, Oregon-based innovative FinTech company has launched a mobile app on iOS and Android that helps traders to take the emotion out of crypto trading. The app is integrated into an Artificial Intelligence (AI) Tool that uses Machine Learning (ML) and trading technical analysis to identify and alert the user with buying and selling points.

value.title: SmartHop raises $30M to boost trucking fintech products
value.excerpt: SmartHop, a startup that uses AI to help interstate truckers make their routes more efficient and lucrative by removing administrative headaches, just raised a $30 million Series B financing round, bringing the company’s total funding to $46 million following a $12 million Series A last year.
